title.narrative: Favoriser le développement des moyens de subsistance et des programmes de santé grâce à des vaccins pour les animaux d'élevage
Livestock Vaccines for Livelihoods and Health Program Development

description.narrative:
To protect livelihoods and human health in Africa and Asia, animals must be healthy. This project will allow international development partners to enhance global knowledge about animal health and vaccine innovations. It will also pave the way for vaccine distribution in Asia and Africa, leading to healthier animals and humans.
Why animal health research is important Livestock and livestock products provide food, nutrition, and income for 752 million poor farmers. By 2050, researchers estimate that food demand for livestock products will nearly double in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia. Yet animal diseases cost farmers millions in losses, constrain trade, and pose a public health threat.
Animal health research has suffered from chronic underinvestment and a lack of coordinated effort. Africa and Asia lack capacity. The current generation of specialists in both regions is nearing retirement age. These are big challenges.
There are opportunities too. By coordinating the international donor community's approach, the problems can be addressed.
Renewed interest in vaccine research Vaccine research is globally underfunded, but is regaining interest among key organizations, such as: -Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation -International Development Research Centre -UK Department for International Development (DFID) -USAID -CGIAR (international agricultural research organization)
The Gates Foundation is funding animal vaccine innovation research and has collaborated with DFID on research projects. IDRC funded two animal vaccine innovation research projects. It is time to coordinate efforts. By working collaboratively, research can be more efficient, these organizations can extend their reach, and they can leverage investments and expertise. This would ensure that resources are directed to resolving key problems in a coordinated manner.
Improving livestock, achieving results This project will lay the groundwork for coordinating and supporting research in the areas of: -new vaccine innovation -refining vaccines to prepare them for market -developing animal health delivery systems to make vaccine distribution viable in Africa and Asia
The most pressing needs are as follows: -conduct research to realize vaccine innovations impacts at a large scale; -understand how different diseases occur, spread, and interact; -evaluate the economic impact of those diseases; and -assess how social factors influence disease management.
Project outcomes This activity will allow the project team to develop a proposal for this multi-funder initiative. Consultants will be hired to develop: -draft logic model and preliminary performance measurement framework -draft risk analysis -draft initial activity plan -draft strategies for gender equity, governance, and sustainability
The project aims to bring the development community together to improve livestock production and to improve income and nutrition in Africa and Asia.
